column5: I,ll be hitting service Can Monday morning.Wonder if they will pay for my parking?
If you hit Service Canada you'll be sorry & COMPLETELY OUT OF LUCK. Try Service Ontario instead. I suggest you call first though as not all offices are on-line with the new system yet.
I renewed my fishing license last year online. Biggest mistake ever I had to print out this piece of paper. A PIECE OF PAPER!.
Three years at a time is the only way you get the card and the tags preprinted on the back.... I think that's the plan to get more funds up front...
Maybe that's what there thinking,but sticking a extra card size paper behind your card is really not a big deal. Give the people a price incentive for three years and watch the 3 year cards sell.

That piece of paper is toast as soon as it gets wet... and wouldn't last a week in my wallet even if it stayed dry. I've bought three years at a time since licencing came out, just to save the hassles.
I wonder if you laminate it ,it would last longer?.
Probably illegal to laminate it.. like birth certificates thru the 80's and on.
Potato salad
I dont need one, but I am going to get one cause the Govt always puts the licence monies back into the fishery

Same with me too Wayne, I've always payed the extra up front for the 3 year license and then don't have to worry about it for awhile.  Fortunately though, I no longer have to worry about it at all anymore
Lew yer a friend,so I wont say,what I think.    Ok I will    You lucky son of a gun.    Well thats the best way I can, without breaking OFC tight fit rules.LOL
It's OK Brian, I know what your trying to say, and I'll forgive you....just this one time
:worthy:
Yer looking at getting an     whoopin, it's yer damm technology.  Lets all run down and burn some more of the whitehouse, or is it the outhouse.

Did mine and the wifes online today....My card expires 2012 so only option i had was 1 year renewal not able to purchase 3yr  Wifes card good til 2013 still only option to purchase a 1 year  so i guess it will be a few years until I can avoid this system lol
Service ontario was no help at all for me. They aren't even set up for licenses yet.  Trust me, try the address change, then renewal, online.  Worked for me anyways.  S.

Did mine at CTC in Welland Dec 27.  It took a clerk & 2 supervisors 15 minutes to figure out the new machine.  Now I have to carry my outdoors card & more paperwork.  Does that mean I'll also have to carry more papers for small game hunting, bear, deer, moose.  What was wrong with putting a sticker on my out doors card?  Too simple I guess??  If it ain't broke, don't fix it!
Shane, them kids just don't want to listen......  BTW I HAD NO TROUBLE GETTING MINE AND A NEW GOOFY CARD....

I know a LOT of us that would like to help you clean the the Whitehouse out....  And you know what they say about computers.....GARBAGE in GARBAGE out...  Seriously.....by March this should be straighten out don't you think, eh...
Well it finally made the news...took some time to get an on camera response from the MNR.  Here is a link to the video:  My link  This should air again tonight at 11pm.
Thanks Jeff.
Don't speak too loudly,  some provinces and states are charging a license fee for seniors.
The OLG must be laughing at the MNR. "durable paper"... this makes me laugh.  Thanks for posting the link. Good stuff.

Chex TV was interviewing local fisher persons today and the topic about the new MNR Outdoors card situation came up.  Chex was going to make an attempt to get an answer from the local MNR office as to why people are still being told 2-3 weeks before they can issue the new piece of paper since the validation stickers are a thing of the past.  I was told this should air on this evenings news at 6pm.
This should be good.
I missed the news could you let me know if anything was aired......I am a betting man, my money is on no comment.

Went into the Parry Sound Ontario government office today to renew....clerks there said best way to get what you need is on-line - the phones are very busy.  The office itself is not on-line yet with the new system and won't be until late January - 24th I think she said. The same was true with several commercial outlets in Parry Sound - Canadian Tire, etc.  Was told that the convenience store in McKellar (30 kilometers out) was up and running so went out there. Entered the front of the store at the exact moment the two owners were bent over the machine and waving their arms in the air. So no go there either.  The machine was supposed to spit out some bilous green stickers. Not sure where the 'card' part of the license comes in and the usually very efficient staff at the Parry Sound office hadn't been advised about it either.  I don't like to use credit cards on the internet so will be patient and try to get through on the phone.
Grabbed mine at CTC in Carleton Place Ontario-io-io!!!  This was after 3 different attempts online with the MNR Store that doesn't sell licenses, just gives headaches for free! Hehe!
I don't know whether it was on CHEX news at 6. I just scanned the 42 minute newscast and saw nothing.
I watched the whole hour, didn't see anything either.  I'm suspecting they(MNR) had a no comment, their pants are down around their ankles moment.

I spent 3/4 of the day yesterday running around trying to get mine renewed. I drove from ptbomnr office, to pickering, and back, and still had no license. Friggen thing wouldn't accept my postal code!!!!  I ended up doing an online address change, then trying the renewal again, and it worked!!!   What a joke!  S.
You may have just solved the complaint I've seen the most!  If everyone did the free on line address set-up first then went to get a license - it may just work like it should!  Michael

Well all the news showed was some sledders and ice fisher persons...no mention of any licence issues.  But they did say on behalf of the local OPP to stay off the ice as it is not safe in places.  In fact I can tell you a local resident on Chemong that resides near the Skyline trailer park went out to pop a few test holes and measured only 2 inches. That was on Wednesday.  We need some low temperatures for a sustained period to grow some ice.  I am just itching to get out  Sure saving money on sled gas
My wife's license expires 2012. Mine expires 2013.  So you guy's get all the bugs worked out so we can have a hassle free renewal.
Ha, by then they will have invented something new and probably need a wheelbarrow to carry all the paperwork around with.

Sounds similar to the fiasco a certain gov't dept who had a big problem with their online camping reservation 'system' a year or so ago!!  Never underestimate bureaucratic myopia/stupidity---it has a history much longer than Canada itself.
That's along the lines that I was thinking as well.
~~~~Boy am I happy I'm old, having just turned 65 last month, it's great to be a Senior

Well I found out why I cant get mine.When they enter my address theres NO  postal code to go with it. It,s crap like this that really piss,s me off.  Im printing off from three other sites, what anglers are dealing with. The hell with them. Im fishing and I look forward to being caught and challanging this crap.

A friend of mine called last night, he spent a couple of hours trying to get his today. Finally managed to get it at CTC here in Lindsay. He was telling me that some of the retailers are really pissed off. One store had over 100 people come in to get licenses and couldn't supply them. People were leaving the store frustrated but it wasn't the stores fault.  And we pay these people big bucks for what?

I just renewed my Outdoors Card & 3 year Sport fishing licence at the Service Ontario site in Aylmer yesterday. It took her almost 15 mins to get it done. Not her fault about the time either as she spent most of the time waiting for the system to go to the next step.Was a problem with the postal code also but she solved it. I got 2 temporary paper tags(Outdoors Card & Fishing Tag) until my card comes in, reported to be 2 weeks. Any tags not bought at the time of Outdoors Card purchase will not be a sticker for the back of the card but a separate paper tag required to be kept on you when needed.

This is only a small example of how inefficient government really is....  Can you imagine all the other do nothing government agencies that are not  uncovered because they are not exposed to the public.....in the USA I would like to see government cut in half.....then take a look at what we really need and cut some more...  Less government is always better....here, there and wherever.....
And where is this system from that we are stuck using now?

Did you try an address change, Brian?  Worked for me. I didn't acutally change my address, just put in my proper address with postal code and it worked. I have a funny feeling my postal code was recorded wrong in the first place. I didn't get a renewal form in the mail either.  S.
Shane,I put the right address in,and clicked find postal code.Came up,no postal code for this address.  Had fun on the ice today.

the address problem can be fixed instantly if the person selling you the license calls the office in tennessee where the license issuing machines are from.  this is how the local vendor solved my issues.  it took ten minutes extra, but i didn't have to go online or anything.
Once again,not from Canada eh.
Try the address change. worked for me, and it said I wasn't even in the system when I first tried!! I know its a total crock, but it beats dealing with authorities.   S.
